poem:
### Surprise TV

In the seaside shack,  
an old TV flickers like a lighthouse  
cutting through fog.  
Children lost  
in a world without filters  
stare at shows chosen by fate,  
not by algorithm,  
astonished by the art of waiting—  
a gift wrapped in static;  
and a moment not swiped away  
but savored.
